content.raw:
It was introduced in pull request #371 and appears to be related to performance. Here's one of my comments in that pull request about the test:
~~~
I ran the transport_stress test with 100 messages on default, and it
took about 3 ms / message. With this branch I ran 1 million messages
in 9.2 seconds, which is about 9 microseconds / message, about 300
times faster.
~~~
I'm guessing that the key part is the time per message, so let's ask @nkoenig if we can scale down the total number of messages, while still expecting the same time per message. 1000 nodes publishing 10 times looks good to me, since it requires much less memory.

It was introduced in pull request #371 and appears to be related to performance. Here's one of my comments in that pull request about the test:

I ran the transport_stress test with 100 messages on default, and it
took about 3 ms / message. With this branch I ran 1 million messages
in 9.2 seconds, which is about 9 microseconds / message, about 300
times faster.

I'm guessing that the key part is the time per message, so let's ask @nkoenig if we can scale down the total number of messages, while still expecting the same time per message. 1000 nodes publishing 10 times looks good to me, since it requires much less memory.
